instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage - General Troubleshooting Question
threads.message:
Hello, I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that had water damage - cleaned it out and everythings good - comes on normally.  After 30 - 45 seconds complete freezes and have to force shut down.

Tried recovery mode, alternate OS, etc all same so it points to hardware.

What would main causes of this be , so I know where to begin troubleshooting?

Thanks! :)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage - General Troubleshooting Question
threads.message:
Seems that it still has crap somewhere, maybe under some BGA chips...
Did you pass it through UC?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage - General Troubleshooting Question
threads.message:
Negative, I am still looking to order a proper ultrasonic for mac boards. Just have one for cell phone boards at the moment.

What is the go to model for ultrasonic cleaning on mac boards?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage - General Troubleshooting Question
threads.message: Be aware to get one with sweep function...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage - General Troubleshooting Question
threads.message: Probably crap under the SMC. But this all depends on where the original damage was. Could be anything really.
